image.altText: Donald Trump stands at a microphone. He is wearing a blue suit and red tie and pictured against a dark background.

items.synopsis: The former US president is indicted over alleged attempts to meddle with the 2020 election results in Georgia. He and 18 allies face a racketeering charge that carries mandatory prison time.

title.children: Trump faces a charge usually aimed at mobsters, with mandatory jail. Here's what we know

items.synopsis: Canberra man Muhammad Arif is charged with allegedly claiming to have explosives on board a Malaysia Airlines flight from Sydney to Kuala Lumpur yesterday.

title.children: 'Confused': Man accused of making explosives threat on Sydney flight doesn't understand charges, court told

image.altText: Olga Carmona runs with her arms out celebrating a Women's World Cup semifinal goal against Sweden.

items.synopsis: After 80 goalless minutes at Eden Park, the first Women's World Cup semifinal explodes to life, with Spain reaching the final after a 2-1 win over Sweden. Follow live.

title.children: Spanish skipper scores in final minute of regulation against Sweden to send La Roja into Women's World Cup final

image.altText: police on a plane after an incident

items.synopsis: Aviation and security experts weigh in on how in-flight threats of violence are handled, and whose jurisdiction it is to respond.

title.children: 'Some of our slightest female crew could take down someone large': How threatening behaviour on planes is dealt with

image.altText: Four people on surf boards bobbing in the ocean, beneath a pale blue sky with clouds

items.synopsis: Four Australians and two Indonesian crew whose boat went missing during a surf trip off the coast of Aceh have been found alive after several days at sea, while one crew member is still missing.

title.children: Australians found 'bobbing around on their surfboards' after going missing in Indonesia

image.altText: Australian goalie Mackenzie Arnold celebrates during penalty shootout against France in Women's World Cup

items.synopsis: If your hero is Sam Kerr, Mary Fowler or Hayley Raso, it's easy to find a jersey with their name on the back. But what if you want represent one of Australia's unpassable goalies?

title.children: The 'disappointing' reason you can't find a Matildas' goalkeeper jersey despite penalty shoot-out heroics

image.altText: CLose up of Dorothy Angell smiling

items.synopsis: Dot Angell worked as a civilian nurse in the Vietnam War. She and other civilians suffered similar mental and physical health problems to returned soldiers and an even longer battle to have their efforts recognised.

title.children: In Vietnam nurses like Dot worked in squalid conditions during the war and their efforts long went unrecognised

image.altText: A man ina full body yellow suit and protective gear lights some wild grass on fire.

items.synopsis: Unlike the rest of the world, the Bureau of Meteorology is still not ready to say an El Niño is underway. But the outlook for spring suggests a dry season ahead, with experts warning of heightened fire risk regardless.

title.children: Why Australia's weather bureau hasn't followed the world in declaring El Niño

image.altText: A Richmond AFL star holds his hand up to salute a group of Tigers fans who are standing at the fence after a win.

items.synopsis: The string of high-profile AFL retirement announcements continues, with Richmond great and triple premiership player Jack Riewoldt to face the media after telling teammates that his 17th season at Punt Road will be his last.

title.children: 'It's the end of an era': Richmond great Jack Riewoldt to call it a day after three flags, 17 seasons

image.altText: Composite image of same area one year apart.

items.synopsis: The snow-making machines can only do so much, and with less and less of the real stuff falling from the sky, ski field operators are counting the cost — and experts say those who love an icy frolic should get used to big snow years becoming "increasingly rare".

title.children: Cold comfort for snow lovers as warmer winter hits ski season hard

image.altText: Gina Rinehart at a podium

items.synopsis: Mining pioneer Lang Hancock's daughter Gina Rinehart ignored an agreement with her father that would have given her children a 49 per cent of his mining assets, WA's Supreme Court hears.

title.children: Gina Rinehart 'took control of everything' when Lang died, cutting off children against his wishes, court hears

image.altText: User interface panel on electric vehicle charge station.

items.synopsis: New electric cars registrations have almost doubled in Tasmania in the past 12 months — with one in 10 cars sold being electric.

title.children: 'You see EVs everywhere': Electric car sales almost double in Tasmania

image.altText: Woman stands smiling in a childcare centre.

items.synopsis: Wages growth eases from an annual pace of 3.7 per cent in the March quarter to 3.6 per cent over the year to June, reducing fears of a so-called wage-price spiral.

title.children: Childcare centres are among many employers 'struggling to find staff'. But wages growth just went backwards

image.altText: Ice near one of the holes on a golf course.

items.synopsis: A greenkeeper believes a large chuck of ice fell from the sky given how deeply it was indented in the ground, saying it's the first time in 17 years in the industry he's come across anything like it.

title.children: A megacryometeor event has happened in Victoria. The unusual ice event left divots in a golf green

image.altText: A fighter jet screams through the air, leaving contrails streaming in its wake.

items.synopsis: The paint for the highly advanced F-35 Lightning II will be applied outside the US for the first time after a government commitment to spend $100m on a facility in Newcastle.

title.children: Australia entrusted with secret paint that makes fighter jet 'nearly invisible'

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt is surrounded by reporters with microphones and cameras.

items.synopsis: The celebrity crocodile wrangler is expected to front court in person later this year, where he'll hear more than 20 volumes of evidence amassed against him.

title.children: 'Enormous' brief of evidence against Netflix star Matt Wright includes 150,000 texts

image.altText: Peta Weber has been missing since 1997.

items.synopsis: A coronial inquest hears harrowing details about what could have happened to the 25-year-old missing for nearly 30 years.

title.children: What really happened to Peta Weber, who disappeared in 1997?

image.altText: Greg Stewart with rail bug

items.synopsis: The railway group volunteer has built a set of rail bugs from scratch, hoping they provide a lifeline for his railway group.

title.children: Greg's pedal-powered plan to get tourism back on track in Tasmania's north-east

image.altText: marine rescue boat in face on shot in spray of ocean swell

items.synopsis: The man is believed to have been swept away while fishing in the Royal National Park near Sydney at the weekend, but a two-day search has uncovered nothing.

title.children: 71-year-old presumed dead likely not wearing a life jacket while rock fishing, say police

image.altText: Schoolgirl holding a trophy.

items.synopsis: Matildas star Mary Fowler's World Cup heroics have inspired the next generation of players at her old school in Cairns. But with more people taking up the sport, the challenge will be finding somewhere for them all to play.

title.children: Mary Fowler was an outstanding talent during her school days in Cairns. Now she's inspiring the new wave of stars

image.altText: Coral reef with small fish

items.synopsis: Australian scientists have found "incredibly high coral cover" in deeper sections of the Coral Sea relatively undisturbed by fishing and sedimentary run-off.

title.children: The Coral Sea lies next Great Barrier Reef. Why don't we know more about it?

image.altText: Video image captures a fire and emergency workers

items.synopsis: A criminal investigation is opened after a blaze at a Russian auto repair shop kills at least 27 and injures over a 100.

title.children: 'It's like a war here': Explosion at Russian car mechanics kills at least 27, injures more than 100

image.altText: Burnt out cars and buildings in Lahaina.

items.synopsis: Search crews are sifting through the rubble of burned-down Maui with the island's governor saying it's likely to find at least 10 more people a day.

title.children: Hawaii wildfires death toll rises with more 'tragic stories' expected

image.altText: A man in sunglasses rests on a bed.

items.synopsis: Shirley McPherson says her dad Alfie Rawlings, who is in his 80s and uses a wheelchair, was last seen at a retirement complex on the Hawaiian island. The death toll from wildfires has risen to 99.

title.children: 'Frantic' Adelaide daughter launches social media search for dad missing in Maui

image.altText: Donald Trump stands in front of a US flag

items.synopsis: Donald Trump is indicted for the second time, this time by the state of Georgia, for attempting to overturn the 2020 election results. Look back on Tuesday's developments.

title.children: Trump's fourth indictment in five months, second for 2020 election interference — as it happened

image.altText: An elderly man in glasses – paedophile Gerald Ridsdale – sits in front of a blank wall.

items.synopsis: The conviction relates to the indecent assault of a minor – Ridsdale's 72nd known victim – in the late 1980s. The court heard that Ridsdale's health is deteriorating and that he may soon be put into palliative care.

title.children: Notorious paedophile priest Gerald Ridsdale sentenced to eighth prison term

image.altText: A man in a hard hat surveys the damage inside a burnt out Chinese restaurant

items.synopsis: One by one, Chinese restaurants across Perth were being set alight. It was a coordinated and sustained terrorism campaign, but most Australians have never heard of the attacks.

title.children: It was 'a taste of terrorism' in suburban Australia, but most people have never heard of it

image.altText: Composite image of two women and two men.

items.synopsis: Authorities are remaining tight-lipped on the investigation into a suspected mushroom poisoning, after the woman at the centre of the saga gave police a detailed written statement.

title.children: Where cook bought mushrooms for beef Wellington lunch under spotlight as she provides new statement

image.altText: An immaculate woman wearing a black and white houndstooth top with scalloped collar gazes adoringly at a yellow handbag

items.synopsis: The latest generation of "superfake" handbags can so closely resemble their luxury counterparts that the differences are almost imperceptible to the human eye.

title.children: Indonesia's 'superfake' bags are cheap, handmade, and virtually indistinguishable from the real deal

image.altText: Sam Kerr running with hand in a fist.

items.synopsis: Football fanatics from diverse backgrounds have found inspiration in Matildas players — including Mary Fowler and Sam Kerr, who are "rewriting the possibilities" for women of colour in sport.

title.children: 'This sport is for all': Matildas fans see their culture reflected in players like Sam Kerr and Mary Fowler

image.altText: Close up shot of a woman of middle-eastern appearance in sunset light on a beach

items.synopsis: Elahe Yazdani arrived in Australia in 2020 after fleeing Iran, but says giving birth to her son in Wollongong was one of the saddest stories of her life.

title.children: Elahe says her experience in a NSW hospital left her traumatised. Experts say this is typical for refugee women
